channel.title: Making veng save on logout
channel.description:
Some people have had this problem so i thought to release it, i did not make this.
Credits Demise.
This will make it so you can't reset vengeance by clicking it again (It's already cast, click it again and it does another) and it will make it so if you relog, you will still have vengeance applied.
Go to the player class and add this.
[CODE]public int castDemise = 0;[/CODE]
Now search for your casting vengeance method. The method is probably in playerAssistant.java, if you haven't found it search for this anim.
[CODE]c.startAnimation(4410);[/CODE]
Now search for
[CODE] = System.currentTimeMillis();[/CODE]
Add this under it
[CODE]c.castDemise = 1;[/CODE]
Now go into your combatAssistant class and search for this
[CODE]forcedText = "Taste Vengeance!";[/CODE]
And add this under it
[CODE]c.castDemise = 0;[/CODE]
That is all the integer changing done, now all you need to do is stop people casting it again when it's already applied, and save that integer.
Search for this in clickingButtons
[CODE]case 118098:[/CODE]
Add this under it
[CODE]if(c.castDemise == 1) { c.sendMessage("You have already cast vengeance!"); }[/CODE]
Now go into your public class playerSave, and search for
[CODE]} else if (token.equals([/CODE]
And add this in just after the bracket
[CODE] else if (token.equals("Demise")) { p.castDemise = Integer.parseInt(token2); }[/CODE]
Now search for this
[CODE]characterfile.newLine();[/CODE]
Add this under it
[CODE]characterfile.write("Demise = ", 0, 9); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.castDemise), 0, Integer.toString(p.castDemise).length()); characterfile.newLine();[/CODE]
And your done! Enjoy and post bugs here.

item.title: Making veng save on logout
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

wouldn’t you have to remove normal veng for this to work? Well you’d at least need to remove the case for veng or your gonna get duplicate cases lol. Stolen from r-serv me thinks + a pointless tut as veng doesn’t save on rs anyways…

Read full topic

item.description:
@i_am_infamy wrote:

Some people have had this problem so i thought to release it, i did not make this.

Credits Demise.

This will make it so you can’t reset vengeance by clicking it again (It’s already cast, click it again and it does another) and it will make it so if you relog, you will still have vengeance applied.

Go to the player class and add this.

Now search for your casting vengeance method. The method is probably in playerAssistant.java, if you haven’t found it search for this anim.

Now search for

Add this under it

Now go into your combatAssistant class and search for this

And add this under it

That is all the integer changing done, now all you need to do is stop people casting it again when it’s already applied, and save that integer.

Search for this in clickingButtons

Add this under it

if(c.castDemise == 1) { c.sendMessage("You have already cast vengeance!"); }

Now go into your public class playerSave, and search for

And add this in just after the bracket

else if (token.equals("Demise")) { p.castDemise = Integer.parseInt(token2); }

Now search for this

Add this under it

characterfile.write("Demise = ", 0, 9); characterfile.write(Integer.toString(p.castDemise), 0, Integer.toString(p.castDemise).length()); characterfile.newLine();

And your done! Enjoy and post bugs here.
